title: 113_s1484
content: The Act may be cited as the "Sabine National Forest Land Exchange Act of 2013". Definitions are provided in the Act. The Act defines key terms such as "Authority" as the Sabine River Authority of Texas, "Federal land" as National Forest System land within Sabine National Forest and Toledo Bend Project boundary, and "non-Federal land" as land not owned by the federal government. The curr_chunk provides definitions for terms related to the National Forest Campgrounds, Toledo Bend Project, including "non-Federal land," "Secretary," "Toledo Bend Project," "wilderness area," and "wilderness candidate land." These definitions clarify the ownership and designation of specific lands within the project area. The curr_chunk defines "wilderness candidate land" as the surface estate of land adjacent to the wilderness area, to be agreed upon by the Authority and the Secretary, owned or to be acquired by the Authority. SEC. 3. LAND EXCHANGE, SABINE NATIONAL FOREST. In exchange for non-Federal land, wilderness candidate land, and any cash payment, the Secretary will convey all US interests in Federal land to the Authority, subject to existing rights. An appraisal must be completed within 180 days according to specific standards. The Secretary will determine the value of Federal land considering restrictions imposed by a covenant. Surveys will identify the land to be exchanged, with costs shared equally. The exchange will be of equal value, with limits on land values waived. The exchange of land under subsection (a) will be conducted on an equal value basis, with limits on land values waived. Cash equalization payments can be used to equalize the values of the land. Any cash payments received will be deposited into a fund for the acquisition of land for the National Forest System. Title to non-Federal land conveyed to the Secretary must be acceptable. Title to the non-Federal land conveyed to the Secretary must be acceptable and conform to the title approval standards of the Attorney General. The deed of conveyance must reserve any subsurface mineral estate owned by the United States. A restrictive covenant must be included in the deed, ensuring the land is used in a manner consistent with adjacent National Forest System land or wilderness area land, remains unsubdivided, and runs with the land. The Authority may operate Forest Service campgrounds and maintain them as authorized by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission. Congress intends for the land exchange to be completed within one year of the Act's enactment. SEC. 4. BOUNDARY ADJUSTMENT, INDIAN MOUNDS WILDERNESS AREA, SABINE NATIONAL FOREST. Boundary Adjustment: After completing the land exchange, the Secretary will modify the boundaries of the wilderness area. This includes excluding land within the Toledo Bend Project and adding wilderness candidate land acquired under section 3(a) to the wilderness area. The Secretary must also file a map and legal description with the appropriate committees. The Secretary will file a map and legal description of the boundary changes resulting from the land exchange with the House and Senate committees. The filed documents will have the same legal effect as if included in the Act, with the Secretary allowed to correct errors. The map and legal description will also be available for public inspection at Forest Service offices.
